message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SD 

This paper is about Semantically-Informed Machine Translation (SIMT) and the use of modality and negation in improving translation quality. It involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques, which are commonly associated with the Computer Science sub-categories of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), and Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of syntactic and semantic information in improving translation quality, which could be relevant to Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Software Engineering (cs.SD) sub-categories.
